B. Policy Multipliers
The independence of policy movements in 1920 and 1937 and the absence

13of additional causes of the recessions of 1921 and 1938 suggest that these twoepisodes can be used to estimate multipliers for monetary and fiscal policy.To actually do this calculation, one merely substitutes the relevant data for1921 and 1938 into equation (1) and then solves the two equation system for
